channel.title: Punk
channel.description:
Any punks left on earth? If you know any good punk bands, please do tell. So far i got
Conflict Operation Ivy Rancid Crass UK Subs Subhumans Nausea Agnostic Front Dead Kennedys Dropkick Murpheys Deviancy Career Soldiers Left Alone Time Again Time Armstrong The Adicts Anti Flag (oldStuff) Aus Rotten Bad Religion Black Flag Cheap Sex Misfits The Exploited GBH Flogging Molly Pennywise MU330 Mustard Plug The Virus The Unseen Monster Squad
AND I SWEAR TO GOD IF YOU SUGGEST THESE BANDS I WILL CUT OFF YOUR BALLS! THEY ARENT PUNK!
My Chemical Romance Good Charlette Simple Plan AFI Green Day or any of your other gay ass emo bands.... Thanks :D
PS: Ska bands are good too

item.title: Punk
item.dc:creator: @Liaramongall Liaramongall
item.description:
@Liaramongall wrote:

I didnt ask for rock bands. I do listen to Metallica… AND THE USED IS THE MOST PUSSY EMO BAND IVE EVER HEARD! So once again people: PUNK BANDS OR SKA BANDS!!! please stop posting your gay rock bands[br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2007, 11:48:51 AM[/size][hr]Sorry… that was a little harsh.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Liaramongall Liaramongall
item.description:
@Liaramongall wrote:

… This isnt really an opinionated forum… I just need some help findin some good old punk bands. And thanks i got some less than jake. Its pretty good, but the newer stuff they did was horrible…

item.title: Punk
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Liaramongall:

Ahaha your so funny. Good charlotte is a waist of my listening. They are the worst band ever and everyone only thinks there punk because one of the guys has a mohawk. I hate them and I hate the media for “titling” them punk. David… THEY ARENT HARDCORE

sorry i must have sounded a bit serious, i was joking
BTW try listening to less than jake… they are ska and one of my oldest favoutist bands.

And yeah the media do suck with what they did to Good Charlotte.

Read full topic

item.title: Punk
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I don’t know if you are counting Ska-Punk up there, but Mustard Plug is Ska-Punk just so you know
How about Beastie Boys. No, not the Hip-Hop days of the Beastie Boys. I’m talking back when they were a Punk band.
Try looking up some of that stuff, it’s good.

-Mh

Read full topic

item.title: Punk
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:5, topic:117153”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=166445.msg1550228#msg1550228 date=1182988696]
GREEN DAY ARE HARDXCORE ROCKING PUNKS AND I KNOW ALL THEIR SONGS FROM AMERICAN IDIOT KUZ DAT R THERE ONLY ALBUM.

Truthfully though try “flogging molly - drunken lullabies” its a good song, and its irish punk
[/quote]

Flogging Molly. good stuff.[/quote]
saw them live, touched the ginger lead singer - lived the dream.
I waited outside for 4 hours just to be the first person into the gig.
